person.note: Du(3) Yan [1730] He was orphaned at age 2 and his mother returned to her family's ancestral home in Jiyuan county where Yan grew up. A local gentry man of apparent distinction, Mr. Xiangli, saw merit in Yan and wanted to make him a son-in-law, but his relatives (qinzu) were all opposed. He did it anyway and after Yan earned the jinshi the following year (therefore, she was 20 when they married), they became reconciled to the marriage. Ancestors were Jingzhao jun Du(3). He was a descendant of Du(3) You [3927] and Su(1) Shunqin's [7064] father-in-law. He recommended Lei(1) Jianfu [965]. His son Shen [3921] was Sansi panguan in 1075, but the bureau is not indicated. Du(3) Yin [3925], the son-in-law of Zeng(1) Gongliang's [8136] brother or cousin has the same generational name as Yan's sons. Zhejiang TZ, 123.19b has jinshi in 1008 and Liangzhe jinshi zhi has jinshi #4 in 1008; XCB, 110.16a, 111.1a; Ouyang Xiu, WJ, 31.1a-4a; Zhang Fangping, WJ, 39.54b-57a (wife, born Xiangli, who married him at age 20 and died in 1065 at age 78); SHY:SH, 56.19b; YLDD, 12507.1b. CBD, 2, 795-7.

desc.label: 累官都官員外郎 知邵武軍 杜衍薦為侍御史 出知壽州 徙泉州
王洙主河北漕 辟為衛州推官 王旦、杜衍交章薦之 改為著作佐郎 歷知惠州
其言事不為激訐 故多見推行 杜衍、范仲淹皆稱道之
改右正言 知制誥 時杜衍、韓琦、范仲淹、富弼相繼罷去 修上疏極諫 出知滁州
